s.text: "There is an increased sense of desperation in China about Taiwan.
Trying to make sense of U.S.-China relations these days can reduce even the most resolute Sinologist to a blubbering wreck.

Yes, China is an emerging power and, yes, China may be the great American rival of the next century, but Americans have transformed China into an otherworldly nation, a mysterious angel, a baffling demon.
Oh, and I forgot to mention that today is the 10 th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre.
So our policy needs firewalls : The American business community shouldn't be able to force the United States to cave on human rights just to improve economic ties.
